summary: The Akkadian Empire was an ancient power in Mesopotamia, ruling around 2400-2200 BC. It was the first known empire in the region, led by King Sargon. The empire united different groups, including Akkadians and Sumerians, and controlled areas from Mesopotamia to the Levant and Anatolia. Sargon's conquests even reached modern-day Saudi Arabia and Oman. The Akkadian language became important during this time. Some historians consider Akkad the first empire, though others have different ideas.
title: Akkadian Empire
